docs.lead_paragraph: Boston closer Andrew Bailey will have surgery on his right thumb, probably ruling him out for most of the season. The injury left Manager Bobby Valentine scrambling for a Plan B to close out games. Candidates include Alfredo Aceves and Mark Melancon.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox pitcher Andrew Bailey will have surgery on his right thumb, keeping him out for most of the season. (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: A fourth grader in the Syracuse suburbs has found out firsthand about the heated rivalry between the Yankees and the Boston Red Sox. When the student, Nathan Johns, showed up in class this week wearing a Yankees T-shirt, he said, his teacher at Van Buren Elementary School told him to go to the bathroom and turn it inside out. Johns complied and said he was later told to wear it that way until the end of the school day.
docs.abstract: Baldwinsville, NY, Elementary School student Nathan Johns, who came to class wearing New York Yankees T-shirt, says he was told by his teacher, Boston Red Sox fan whose name is not mentioned, to go to bathroom and turn his shirt inside out (S)
docs.snippet: A fourth grader in the Syracuse suburbs has found out firsthand about the heated rivalry between the Yankees and the Boston Red Sox.     When the student, Nathan Johns, showed up in class this week wearing a Yankees T-shirt, he said, his teacher a...

headline.main: Pupil Told to Cover His Yankees Shirt

docs.lead_paragraph: Scott Boras leaned against a beige pillar in the lobby of the Walt Disney World Dolphin hotel here Tuesday night, and it instantly became the most crowded place in the resort. Dozens of reporters from three countries flocked to his side, waiting to ask about his high-profile clients. Boras, the most powerful agent in baseball, announced that outfielder J. D. Drew had finally agreed to a five-year, $70 million contract with the Boston Red Sox, and that Greg Maddux was close to signing a one-year deal with the San Diego Padres. Maddux's deal would be worth $10 million and includes a player option for a second year. Drew's deal is contingent on passing a physical. Both played with the Los Angeles Dodgers last season.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox sign J D Drew to five-year, $70 million contract; photo (S)

headline.main: Drew Agrees to Contract as the Red Sox Reload

docs.lead_paragraph: IF the Red Sox think they had it bad for 86 years under the Curse of the Bambino, they better beware of the Carroll Curse. ''I am so against them now I don't watch them,'' Charles Carroll said. ''I hope they lose. I put a Carroll curse on them. If they think the Babe Ruth curse was bad, wait till they see this one.'' Then he added: ''They were good to me. What happened I don't know.''
docs.snippet: A former Boston police detective and security supervisor for the Red Sox, Charles Carroll is conflicted. And it's all because of a World Series ring....

headline.main: For Red Sox, if It's Not One Curse, It's Another

docs.lead_paragraph: Boston Red Sox pitcher Matt Clement was hit on the right side of his head by a line drive off the bat of Carl Crawford with one out in the bottom of the third inning Tuesday night. He was carried from the field on a stretcher. Clement could be seen blinking his eyes when he was placed on the stretcher. The Red Sox said he was conscious and alert as he was taken to the Bayfront Medical Center near Tropicana Field for evaluation.
docs.snippet: Boston Red Sox pitcher Matt Clement was hit on the right side of his head by a line drive off the bat of Tampa Bay's Carl Crawford....

headline.main: Red Sox Come Back After Injury to Clement

docs.lead_paragraph: Boston Red Sox Manager Terry Francona did not have a heart attack and results of medical tests on him ''are very good,'' Boston's team doctor said Thursday. Francona was taken from Yankee Stadium to New York-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell Hospital in Manhattan on Wednesday morning, before the finale of the Red Sox-Yankees series, having felt tightness in his chest. He was transferred to Massachusetts General Hospital here later in the day.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox manager Terry Francona will undergo tests after going to hospital for chest pains, but did not suffer heart attack (S)
docs.snippet: Boston Manager Terry Francona was taken Wednesday from New York to Boston, where his case is being supervised by the team physician....

docs.lead_paragraph: Until Theo Epstein became the general manager of the Boston Red Sox two years ago, at 28 -- an age when many young people are still wrestling with decisions over whether to become novelists or prosecutors -- life had offered him little cause to believe in superstition. Fortune had not been stingy with Epstein, the Yale-educated son of a prominent literary family. In the world of the Red Sox, though, where omen is identity, Epstein began to embrace habits peculiar to serious-minded corporate managers, especially in recent weeks, as the Red Sox proceeded to historic successes.
docs.snippet: Until Theo Epstein became the general manager of the Boston Red Sox two years ago, at 28, life had offered him little cause to believe in superstition....

headline.main: New-Age General Manager Ends an Age-Old Curse

docs.lead_paragraph: THINGS look great for the Boston Red Sox this morning. They are one game from breaking the most infamous jinx in sports history: they are a game from winning their first World Series in 86 years. Nobody here hates the Red Sox, and before their 4-1 victory over St. Louis last night in Game 3, I was convinced that the lack of negative energy -- not the Cardinals -- was the greatest challenge for this bedeviled franchise.
docs.snippet: If the Red Sox are going to win the Series, they have to do it without the negativity of a heated rivalry....

headline.main: In Civil St. Louis, It's the Home Team That Hears the Boos

docs.lead_paragraph: Orlando Cabrera is swiping Manny Ramirez's wristbands, mimicking swings for Ellis Burks, furiously taping and retaping his bats in front of David Ortiz. He makes more sudden movements than a Pedro Martínez breaking ball. No one will ever mistake Cabrera, 29, for Nomar Garciaparra. It is more likely that he will be confused for a player's son who has just swigged three colas, swallowed a couple of candy bars and been set loose on an entire major league team. Now you see him, now you see him again.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox have gone 27-8 since replacing shortstop Nomar Garciaparra with Orlando Cabrera, who is noted by fans and players for fitting in so well personality-wise; photos (M)
docs.snippet: Ever since Nomar Garciaparra was traded for Orlando Cabrera, the Boston Red Sox have gone 27-8....

headline.main: Red Sox' New Shortstop Fits Like a Glove
